result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. Puls

defendant.name: Puls, Ryan J.

records.addlTxt:
9:03 AM/Room 301.  Defendant Ryan J. Puls in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Ryan J. Puls.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF31 and 22FO64. 22CF31- Attny Laufenberg indicates Def. wants to waive P.H. Def. in agreement. Waiver form reviewed. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for filing of Information. Information e-filed and emailed to counsel. Attny Laufenberg acknowledges receipt, waives reading, reserves jurisdictional objection and enters pleas of not guilty. Court receives pleas of not guilty. STC to be set. 22F064 to track. Def. advised to keep address current with counsel and COC. Attny Laufenberg is not yet counsel on 22FO64; Def. will need to appear at STC on that case if doesn't hire counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:56 PM Defendant Ryan J. Puls in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg, via zoom.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Laufenberg has copy of complaint, bond already set, waives reading and waives time limits for p.h.  Def. agrees to waive time limits for p.h.  Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. Bond continues  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
